info.description: Mapping of gene coordinates from scaffolds to chromosomes for T. gondii type II ME49 strain, generated by L. David Sibley (Washington University in St. Louis). Contact: L. David Sibley sibley@borcim.wustl.edu

info.displayName: T. gondii ME49 Gene Predictions from GLEAN
info.description: GLEAN is an automated gene predictor that integrates different evidence of gene structure to produce a consensus gene. For more informtaion click here or to download GLEAN click here. Gene predictions for T. gondii produced by GLEAN, provided by Aaron Mackey, David Roos (University of Pennsylvania).

info.displayName: T. gondii ME49 Gene Predictions from GlimmerHMM
info.description: GlimmerHMM was trained against 330+ manually curated genes. Gene predictions for T. gondii produced by GlimmerHMM, provided by Aaron Mackey, David Roos (University of Pennsylvania).

info.displayName: T. gondii ME49 Gene Predictions from TigrScan
info.description: TigrScan was trained for T. gondii by TIGR; the parameters are available here. Gene predictions for T. gondii produced by TigrScan, provided by Aaron Mackey, David Roos (University of Pennsylvania).

info.displayName: T. gondii ME49 Gene Predictions from TwinScan
info.description: TwinScan (version 2) was trained against 330+ manually curated genes. No informant sequence was used. Gene predictions for T. gondii produced by TwinScan, provided by Aaron Mackey, David Roos (University of Pennsylvania).

info.displayName: T. gondii ME49 Gene Predictions from TwinScanEt
info.description: Gene predictions for T. gondii produced by TwinScanET, provided by Aaron Mackey, David Roos (University of Pennsylvania). Contact: help@toxodb.org

info.displayName: Expression profiling of the 3 archetypal T. gondii lineages
info.institution: Department of Biology, University of Pennsylvania
info.description:
Expression profiling of two strains from each of the 3 archetypal T. gondii lineages was generated as per the following experiment:
At least three T25 flasks containing confluent monolayers of human foreskin fibroblasts grown in D10 media were infected with approximately 1x107 T. gondii tachyzoite parasites per strain. After 6hrs, the media was replaced with fresh D10. Approximately 40hr post-infection (and prior to observable host cell lysis), media was removed and flasks were washed once with 1x cold PBS. Cell monolayers were scraped in 5ml 1x cold PBS, and centrifuged for 12min, 750g at 4C. Supernatant was removed, and RNA was isolated from the cell pellets using Qiagen RNEasy kit according to manufacturer's instructions.
Strains utilized:
Type I:   RH and GT1
Type II:  Pru and ME49
Type III: CTG and VEG
This data was graciously provided to ToxoDB pre-publication by Paul Davis and David Roos.

info.displayName: T.gondii M. White Cell Cycle Array Profiles
info.description: Cell cycle expression profiles from Behnke MS, Wootton JC, Lehmann M, Radke JB, Lucas O, Nawas J, Sibley DL, White MW.

info.displayName: Bradyzoite Differentiation (Multiple 6-hr time points and Extended time series)
info.description:
Expression profiles of T. gondii time series (Multiple 6-hr time points and Extended time series).
This data was graciously provided to ToxoDB pre-publication by Paul Davis, Florence Dzierszinski and David Roos.

Lineage and developmental gene expression: type I GT1, type II Me49, and type III CTGara strains under normal (tachyzoite) and induced (Compound 1 and pH 8.2) conditions. Click here for link to GEO.
The alkaline condition data set was graciously provided directly by Michael Behnke and Michael White.
This data was graciously provided to ToxoDB pre-publication by Matt Zack Anderson and John C. Boothroyd.

resource.internalDescrip: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation data from Kami Kims lab

info.description:
Chromatin Immunoprecipitation chip data identifying regions of active transcription. This data was generated by Mathieu Gissot, J. Eduardo Fajardo, Louis M. Weiss, Andras Fiser, Kami Kim Albert Einstein College of Medicine, This data was graciously provided to ToxoDB pre-publication. Peak calls were made by the data provider.
Contact Kami Kim, kkim@aecom.yu.edu, for further information

resource.internalDescrip: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation called peak data from Kami Kims lab

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray for Called Peaks
info.description: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation chip data identifying regions of active transcription. Peak calls were made by the data provider.

resource.internalDescrip: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation data from Hakimi

info.description: Using chromatin immunoprecipitation and microarray hybridization (Nimblegen arrays), we analyzed the patterns ofDNA-bound Histone H4(K5-K8-K12-K16) acetylation after 4 hours treatment of RH strain with DMSO (control) or 40 nM of FR235222 (named previously drug A) which is a Toxoplasma-specific HDAC inhibitor. ChIP-on-chip isolated DNA samples (input and immunopurified DNA) were arrayed on custom synthetic oligo arrays (387,000 features per array, 46-50 mer oligos, 2 arrays for the whole genome; Nimblegen). Peak calls were made by the data provider. Data provided by Mohamed-Ali Hakimi, Institut Jean Roget.

resource.internalDescrip: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation called peak data from Hakimi

info.displayName: Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Microarray for Called Peaks - Hakimi
info.description: Using chromatin immunoprecipitation and microarray hybridization (Nimblegen arrays), we analyzed the patterns ofDNA-bound Histone H4(K5-K8-K12-K16) acetylation after 4 hours treatment of RH strain with DMSO (control) or 40 nM of FR235222 (named previously drug A) which is a Toxoplasma-specific HDAC inhibitor. ChIP-on-chip isolated DNA samples (input and immunopurified DNA) were arrayed on custom synthetic oligo arrays (387,000 features per array, 46-50 mer oligos, 2 arrays for the whole genome; Nimblegen). Peak calls were made by the data provider.

resource.internalDescrip: Toxoplasma centromere peaks from Einstein|2009-06-18
resource.pluginArgs: --extDbName %EXT_DB_NAME% --extDbRlsVer %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --mapFile @gusHome@/lib/xml/isf/ToxoDB/toxoFeatures2gus.xml --inputFileOrDir @downloadDir@/Einstein_Centromeres/jb_called_centromeres.gff --fileFormat gff2 --gff2GroupTag ID --naSequenceSubclass VirtualSequence --seqIdColumn source_id --seqExtDbName "Chromosome Map - David Sibley" --seqExtDbRlsVer "2008-08-28" --soCvsVersion @soVer@ --defaultOrganism "Toxoplasma gondii" --handlerExternalDbs "enzyme:enzymeDB:2008-07-01" --bioperlTreeOutput @pipelineDir@/logs/toxoCentromeres.bioperl

info.description:
Identification Toxoplasma gondii centromeres was performed by ChIP-chip using antibodies to Centromeric Histone 3 (CenH3-HA) colocalized with antibodies to H3K9me2. (Mathieu Gissot, Carrie F. Brooks, Boris Striepen, Kami Kim. Manuscript in preparation).
Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Bronx, NY (MG, KK) and University of Georgia, Athens, GA (CFB, BS)
For further information please contacts Kami Kim (kkim@aecom.yu.edu) or Boris Striepen (striepen@cb.uga.edu).

resource.internalDescrip: T. gondii cosmid ends

info.description:
Sequence from cosmid ends mapped against T. gondii ME49, VEG and GT1 scaffolds.
End-sequence data from cosmid clones were provided by Ian Paulsen at TIGR. Sequencing was done using T3 and T7 primers represented as TH and TV, respectively, in the sequence IDs.
Cosmids with the TOX designation originated from Boris Striepen's laboratory, while those that start with PSB are from David Sibley's group. A detailed description of cosmid libararies from the Sibly lab is available here.
